lines.text: "Do I feel lucky?" Well, do ya, punk?
Callahan... I don't want any more trouble like you had last year in the Fillmore district. You understand? That's my policy.
Yeah, well, when an adult male is chasing a female with intent to commit rape, I shoot the bastard - that's my policy.
Intent? How'd you establish that?
When a naked man is chasing a woman through a dark alley with a butcher knife and a hard on, I figure he isn't out collecting for the Red Cross.
[leaves]
I think he's got a point.
I gots to know.
Sure, Harry. We can save the leg.
[takes out some scissors]
What are you going to do with those?
Going to cut your pants off.
No. I'll take them off.
It'll hurt.
$29.50, let it hurt.
[after a battered crook has accused Harry of beating him]
Have you been following that man?
Yeah, I've been following him on my own time. And anybody can tell I didn't do that to him.
How?
Cause he looks too damn good, that's how!

[introducing Harry to the mayor]
Mr. Mayor, Inspector Callahan
All right. Let's have it.
Have what?
You report. What have you been doing?
Well, for the past three-quarters of an hour, I've been sitting on my ass waiting on you.
Why do they call you "Dirty Harry"?
Limeys, Micks, Hebes, Fat Dagos, Niggers, Honkies, Chinks, you name it.
How does he feel about Mexicans?
Ask him.
Especially Spics.
[Harry is getting a dressing-down for his most recent arrest]
You're lucky I'm not indicting you for assault with intent to commit murder.
What?

Where the hell does it say that you've got a right to kick down doors, torture suspects, deny medical attention and legal counsel? Where have you been? Does Escobedo ring a bell? Miranda? I mean, you must have heard of the Fourth Amendment. What I'm saying is that man had rights.
Well, I'm all broken up about that man's rights.
You know, you're crazy if you think you've heard the last of this guy. He's gonna kill again.
How do you know?
'Cause he likes it.
every dirty job that comes along.
You need any help, Harry?
Go on out and get some air, fatso!
[turns to killer]

[pleading]
Please! No more! I'm hurt! Can't you see I'm hurt? You shot me! Please, don't, don't! Let me have a doctor, let-let me have a doctor. Please, get me the doctor! Don't kill me!
The girl, where is she?

[crying with reason]
You tried to kill me!
If I tried that, your head would be splattered all over this field.
[demanding]
Now, where's the girl?

[almost crying]
I want a lawyer.

[angered]
I said, where's the girl?

[cries]
I have the rights to a lawyer.

[raises his voice]
Where's the girl?
I have the rights to a lawyer!
[Harry looks at Scorpio's wound on his leg]
Don't, please!
[Harry begins begins to slowly push his shoe on the wound]
I have right to a lawYEEER!
[Scorpio begins to scream in pain as the camera zooms out]
You from around here?
Yeah, but I went to school at San Jose State.
You play ball?
Uh, no, I boxed. Light heavyweight.
Just what I need, it's a college boy.
You haven't found one thing you like about me?
Well, it's early yet. Get your degree?
Sociology.
Sociology? Oh, you'll go far. That's if you live.
The usual lunch or the usual dinner?
Well, what difference does that make?
None.
Say Jaffe, is that Tan Ford still parked in front of the bank?
Tan ford...
[checks]
Yep. Tan Ford.
Engine running?
I don't know. How can I tell?
Exhaust fumes coming from the tailpipe.
Oh, my God. That is awful. Look at all that pollution.

[Harry turns to see]
Yeah. Do me a favor.
[gives him slip of paper]
Call this number.
Police department?
Yeah. Tell them Inspector Callahan thinks there's a 211 in progress at the bank. Be sure and tell them that's IN progress.
211. Yes sir.
[goes to phone and starts dialing up]
Now, if they'll just wait for the cavalry to arrive.
[Suddenly a gun shot goes off and an alarm bell follows immediately]
Ah, shit.
Get out of the way, Hammerhead.
There must be something you can get him on.
Without the evidence of the gun and the girl, I couldn't convict him of spitting on the sidewalk.
Are you trying to tell me that ballistics can't match the bullet up to this rifle?
It does not matter what ballistics can do. This rifle might make a nice souvenir. But it's inadmissible as evidence.
And who says that?
It's the law.
Well, then the law is crazy.

[Big Black has just been given a wad of cash by Scorpio]
You want to go all the way?
Every penny's worth.
Relax. Take it easy. It's gonna be all right.
[pulls on a pair of leather gloves and methodically beats Scorpio into a bloody pulp]
You sure you want the rest of it?
Every penny's worth, you black son of a bitch!

[kicks Scorpio hard]
This one's on the house!
[flattens him with one last punch and walks away]
Morning, Harry.
Morning, fatso. Bressler wants to see you.
You're a sweet man, Harry.
Freeze cop. Now, left hand, pull out your gun.
[Harry pulls out his .44 Magnum]
My, that's a big one.
Callahan? You willing to take the money to him?
When will you people stop messing around with this guy? He's gotta be stopped now!
He's got a busload of kids and I can't take that chance. I gave my word of honor on it and he will not be molested! That's a direct order, Callahan!
Well, you can just get yourself another delivery boy.

[Harry is being lifted by a crane to try to talk down a suicide jumper standing on the edge of a building]
Don't you try to get me!

[chuckles]
Not me, no. You're the one who wants to get yourself killed. Not me. That always happens with you men, you know? At the last minute, you wanna grab on to something or take somebody with you, but down you go. Not me, brother.
Aren't you gonna try to grab me?

A friend of mine was up about 20 floors with a jumper a few years ago. The jumper grabbed him, they went off, 20 floors down. Just mashed 'em all to bits. You couldn't tell which legs were which, you couldn't tell which arms were which, it was a terrible mess. And I'll tell ya, I almost threw up myself. I'd just like your name and address, that's all.
Why?
Well like I said, it's such a mess down there afterwards. And it makes identification impossible, even if they do find your driver's license in all that blood and everything.
I think... I think I'm gonna puke!
Aw, don't do that, son. I mean all those people down there looking up? The fire chief looking up, his face?
YOU ROTTEN BASTARD!
[Jumps from the edge and grabs a hold of the crane, trying to bring Harry down with him]
LET ME LOOSE!
[Harry punches him out cold, and delivers him safely to the ground]

[to Harry Callahan]
No, don't pass out on me now cop! No, no, no, no, no. Don't pass out on me yet, you dirty, rotten oinker! Do we understand each other? You better answer me, if you want to know where the girl is. Okay? Now listen... I've changed my mind. I'm going to let her die! I just wanted you to know that. You hear me? I just wanted you to know that before I killed you!
[laughs crazily]
Goodbye, Callahan!
[Chico fires at Scorpio to defend Harry, who's lying on the ground]
Chico! Don't... kill him!
No wonder they call him "Dirty Harry", always gets the shit end of the stick.
One more word out of you and you're chopped off at the ankles!

[Scorpio has jacked and the unaware kids are singing with him]
Row, row, row your boat/gently down the stream/merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily...
Where are we going?
What? What did you say?
Where are we going?
We're going to the ice-cream factory and see how ice-cream's made. Now anybody who doesn't wanna go can get off right here.
I wanna go home to my mommy.

[slaps the kid]
Stupid kid! Come on sing everyone! Sing or I'll go home and kill all your mommies, sing, sing!

[kids reluctantly sing with Scorpio]
... gently down the stream/merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily,/ life is quite a dream!
Oh please, I scare easy.
Well where are you going?
I'll tell the pilot when I get on the plane. No alerts, nothing.
I guarantee you you will not be molested in any way.

[speaking into his hidden microphone]
Couple of kids necking.
Boys or girls?

[noticing Scorpio's battered face]
What the hell happened to you?
My wife's brother. I hit her, so he hit me... several times.
Drop the gun, freeze! I'll blow his brains out! DROP THE FUCKING GUN!

[points to what he wants]
Ah, yeah. I'll take one of those.

[gets it and rings it up]
$5.69
